trans-unit.source: Runbook execution in Azure Automation
trans-unit.target: Runbook execution in Azure Automation

trans-unit.source: Describes the details of how a runbook in Azure Automation is processed.
trans-unit.target: Describes the details of how a runbook in Azure Automation is processed.

trans-unit.source: Runbook execution in Azure Automation
trans-unit.target: Runbook execution in Azure Automation

trans-unit.source: When you start a runbook in Azure Automation, a job is created.
trans-unit.target: When you start a runbook in Azure Automation, a job is created.

trans-unit.source: A job is a single execution instance of a runbook.
trans-unit.target: A job is a single execution instance of a runbook.

trans-unit.source: An Azure Automation worker is assigned to run each job.
trans-unit.target: An Azure Automation worker is assigned to run each job.

trans-unit.source: While workers are shared by multiple Azure accounts, jobs from different Automation accounts are isolated from one another.
trans-unit.target: While workers are shared by multiple Azure accounts, jobs from different Automation accounts are isolated from one another.

trans-unit.source: You do not have control over which worker will service the request for your job.
trans-unit.target: You do not have control over which worker will service the request for your job.

trans-unit.source: A single runbook can have multiple jobs running at one time.
trans-unit.target: A single runbook can have multiple jobs running at one time.

trans-unit.source: When you view the list of runbooks in the Azure portal, it will list the status of the last job that was started for each runbook.
trans-unit.target: When you view the list of runbooks in the Azure portal, it will list the status of the last job that was started for each runbook.

trans-unit.source: You can view the list of jobs for each runbook in order to track the status of each.
trans-unit.target: You can view the list of jobs for each runbook in order to track the status of each.

trans-unit.source: For a description of the different job statuses, see [Job Statuses](#job-statuses).
trans-unit.target: For a description of the different job statuses, see [Job Statuses](#job-statuses).

trans-unit.source: Job Statuses
trans-unit.target: Job Statuses

trans-unit.source: Your jobs will have access to your Azure resources by making a connection to your Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: Your jobs will have access to your Azure resources by making a connection to your Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: They will only have access to resources in your data center if those resources are accessible from the public cloud.
trans-unit.target: They will only have access to resources in your data center if those resources are accessible from the public cloud.

trans-unit.source: Job statuses
trans-unit.target: Job statuses

trans-unit.source: The following table describes the different statuses that are possible for a job.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes the different statuses that are possible for a job.

trans-unit.source: Status
trans-unit.target: Status

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Completed
trans-unit.target: Completed

trans-unit.source: The job completed successfully.
trans-unit.target: The job completed successfully.

trans-unit.source: Failed
trans-unit.target: Failed

trans-unit.source: The job ended with an error.
trans-unit.target: The job ended with an error.

trans-unit.source: Failed, waiting for resources
trans-unit.target: Failed, waiting for resources

trans-unit.source: The job failed because it reached the [fair share](#fairshare) limit three times and started from the same checkpoint or from the start of the runbook each time.
trans-unit.target: The job failed because it reached the [fair share](#fairshare) limit three times and started from the same checkpoint or from the start of the runbook each time.

trans-unit.source: Queued
trans-unit.target: Queued

trans-unit.source: The job is waiting for resources on an Automation worker to come available so that it can be started.
trans-unit.target: The job is waiting for resources on an Automation worker to come available so that it can be started.

trans-unit.source: Starting
trans-unit.target: Starting

trans-unit.source: The job has been assigned to a worker, and the system is in the process of starting it.
trans-unit.target: The job has been assigned to a worker, and the system is in the process of starting it.

trans-unit.source: Resuming
trans-unit.target: Resuming

trans-unit.source: The system is in the process of resuming the job after it was suspended.
trans-unit.target: The system is in the process of resuming the job after it was suspended.

trans-unit.source: Running
trans-unit.target: Running

trans-unit.source: The job is running.
trans-unit.target: The job is running.

trans-unit.source: Running, waiting for resources
trans-unit.target: Running, waiting for resources

trans-unit.source: The job has been unloaded because it reached the [fair share](#fairshare) limit.
trans-unit.target: The job has been unloaded because it reached the [fair share](#fairshare) limit.

trans-unit.source: It will resume shortly from its last checkpoint.
trans-unit.target: It will resume shortly from its last checkpoint.

trans-unit.source: Stopped
trans-unit.target: Stopped

trans-unit.source: The job was stopped by the user before it was completed.
trans-unit.target: The job was stopped by the user before it was completed.

trans-unit.source: Stopping
trans-unit.target: Stopping

trans-unit.source: The system is in the process of stopping the job.
trans-unit.target: The system is in the process of stopping the job.

trans-unit.source: Suspended
trans-unit.target: Suspended

trans-unit.source: The job was suspended by the user, by the system, or by a command in the runbook.
trans-unit.target: The job was suspended by the user, by the system, or by a command in the runbook.

trans-unit.source: A job that is suspended can be started again and will resume from its last checkpoint or from the beginning of the runbook if it has no checkpoints.
trans-unit.target: A job that is suspended can be started again and will resume from its last checkpoint or from the beginning of the runbook if it has no checkpoints.

trans-unit.source: The runbook will only be suspended by the system in the case of an exception.
trans-unit.target: The runbook will only be suspended by the system in the case of an exception.

trans-unit.source: By default, ErrorActionPreference is set to **Continue** meaning that the job will keep running on an error.
trans-unit.target: By default, ErrorActionPreference is set to **Continue** meaning that the job will keep running on an error.

trans-unit.source: If this preference variable is set to **Stop** then the job will suspend on an error.
trans-unit.target: If this preference variable is set to **Stop** then the job will suspend on an error.

trans-unit.source: Suspending
trans-unit.target: Suspending

trans-unit.source: The system is attempting to suspend the job at the request of the user.
trans-unit.target: The system is attempting to suspend the job at the request of the user.

trans-unit.source: The runbook must reach its next checkpoint before it can be suspended.
trans-unit.target: The runbook must reach its next checkpoint before it can be suspended.

trans-unit.source: If it has already passed its last checkpoint, then it will complete before it can be suspended.
trans-unit.target: If it has already passed its last checkpoint, then it will complete before it can be suspended.

trans-unit.source: Viewing job status using the Azure Management Portal
trans-unit.target: Viewing job status using the Azure Management Portal

trans-unit.source: Automation Dashboard
trans-unit.target: Automation Dashboard

trans-unit.source: The Automation Dashboard shows a summary of all of the runbooks for a particular automation account.
trans-unit.target: The Automation Dashboard shows a summary of all of the runbooks for a particular automation account.

trans-unit.source: It also includes a Usage Overview for the account.
trans-unit.target: It also includes a Usage Overview for the account.

trans-unit.source: The summary graph shows the number of total jobs for all runbooks that entered each status over a given number of days or hours.
trans-unit.target: The summary graph shows the number of total jobs for all runbooks that entered each status over a given number of days or hours.

trans-unit.source: You can select the time range on the top right corner of the graph.
trans-unit.target: You can select the time range on the top right corner of the graph.

trans-unit.source: The time axis of the chart will change according to the type of time range that you select.
trans-unit.target: The time axis of the chart will change according to the type of time range that you select.

trans-unit.source: You can choose whether to display the line for a particular status by clicking on it at the top of screen.
trans-unit.target: You can choose whether to display the line for a particular status by clicking on it at the top of screen.

trans-unit.source: You can use the following steps to display the Automation Dashboard.
trans-unit.target: You can use the following steps to display the Automation Dashboard.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, select **Automation** and then then click the name of an automation account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, select **Automation** and then then click the name of an automation account.

trans-unit.source: Select the **Dashboard** tab.
trans-unit.target: Select the **Dashboard** tab.

trans-unit.source: Runbook Dashboard
trans-unit.target: Runbook Dashboard

trans-unit.source: The Runbook Dashboard shows a summary for a single runbook.
trans-unit.target: The Runbook Dashboard shows a summary for a single runbook.

trans-unit.source: The summary graph shows the number of total jobs for the runbook that entered each status over a given number of days or hours.
trans-unit.target: The summary graph shows the number of total jobs for the runbook that entered each status over a given number of days or hours.

trans-unit.source: You can select the time range on the top right corner of the graph.
trans-unit.target: You can select the time range on the top right corner of the graph.

trans-unit.source: The time axis of the chart will change according to the type of time range that you select.
trans-unit.target: The time axis of the chart will change according to the type of time range that you select.

trans-unit.source: You can choose whether to display the line for a particular status by clicking on it at the top of screen.
trans-unit.target: You can choose whether to display the line for a particular status by clicking on it at the top of screen.

trans-unit.source: You can use the following steps to display the Runbook Dashboard.
trans-unit.target: You can use the following steps to display the Runbook Dashboard.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, select **Automation** and then then click the name of an automation account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, select **Automation** and then then click the name of an automation account.

trans-unit.source: Click the name of a runbook.
trans-unit.target: Click the name of a runbook.

trans-unit.source: Select the **Dashboard** tab.
trans-unit.target: Select the **Dashboard** tab.

trans-unit.source: Job Summary
trans-unit.target: Job Summary

trans-unit.source: You can view a list of all of the jobs that have been created for a particular runbook and their most recent status.
trans-unit.target: You can view a list of all of the jobs that have been created for a particular runbook and their most recent status.

trans-unit.source: You can filter this list by job status and the range of dates for the last change to the job.
trans-unit.target: You can filter this list by job status and the range of dates for the last change to the job.

trans-unit.source: Click on the name of a job to view its detailed information and its output.
trans-unit.target: Click on the name of a job to view its detailed information and its output.

trans-unit.source: The detailed view of the job includes the values for the runbook parameters that were provided to that job.
trans-unit.target: The detailed view of the job includes the values for the runbook parameters that were provided to that job.

trans-unit.source: You can use the following steps to view the jobs for a runbook.
trans-unit.target: You can use the following steps to view the jobs for a runbook.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, select **Automation** and then then click the name of an automation account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, select **Automation** and then then click the name of an automation account.

trans-unit.source: Click the name of a runbook.
trans-unit.target: Click the name of a runbook.

trans-unit.source: Select the **Jobs** tab.
trans-unit.target: Select the **Jobs** tab.

trans-unit.source: Click on the **Job Created** column for a job to view its detail and output.
trans-unit.target: Click on the **Job Created** column for a job to view its detail and output.

trans-unit.source: Retrieving job status using Windows PowerShell
trans-unit.target: Retrieving job status using Windows PowerShell

trans-unit.source: You can use the [Get-AzureAutomationJob](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn690263.aspx) to retrieve the jobs created for a runbook and the details of a particular job.
trans-unit.target: You can use the [Get-AzureAutomationJob](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn690263.aspx) to retrieve the jobs created for a runbook and the details of a particular job.

trans-unit.source: If you start a runbook with Windows PowerShell using [Start-AzureAutomationRunbook](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn690259.aspx), then it will return the resulting job.
trans-unit.target: If you start a runbook with Windows PowerShell using [Start-AzureAutomationRunbook](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn690259.aspx), then it will return the resulting job.

trans-unit.source: Use [Get-AzureAutomationJob](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn690263.aspx)Output to get a job’s output.
trans-unit.target: Use [Get-AzureAutomationJob](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn690263.aspx)Output to get a job’s output.

trans-unit.source: The following sample commands retrieves the last job for a sample runbook and displays it’s status, the values provide for the runbook parameters, and the output from the job.
trans-unit.target: The following sample commands retrieves the last job for a sample runbook and displays it’s status, the values provide for the runbook parameters, and the output from the job.

trans-unit.source: Fair share
trans-unit.target: Fair share

trans-unit.source: In order to share resources among all runbooks in the cloud, Azure Automation will temporarily unload any job after it has been running for 3 hours and then restart it from its last [checkpoint](http://technet.microsoft.com/library/dn469257.aspx#bk_Checkpoints).
trans-unit.target: In order to share resources among all runbooks in the cloud, Azure Automation will temporarily unload any job after it has been running for 3 hours and then restart it from its last [checkpoint](http://technet.microsoft.com/library/dn469257.aspx#bk_Checkpoints).

trans-unit.source: During this time, the job will show a status of Running, Waiting for Resources.
trans-unit.target: During this time, the job will show a status of Running, Waiting for Resources.

trans-unit.source: If the runbook has no checkpoints or the job had not reached the first checkpoint before being unloaded, then it will restart from the beginning.
trans-unit.target: If the runbook has no checkpoints or the job had not reached the first checkpoint before being unloaded, then it will restart from the beginning.

trans-unit.source: If the runbook restarts from the same checkpoint or from the beginning of the runbook three consecutive times, it will be terminated with a status of Failed, waiting for resources.
trans-unit.target: If the runbook restarts from the same checkpoint or from the beginning of the runbook three consecutive times, it will be terminated with a status of Failed, waiting for resources.

trans-unit.source: This is to protect from runbooks running indefinitely without completing, as they are not able to make it to the next checkpoint without being unloaded again.
trans-unit.target: This is to protect from runbooks running indefinitely without completing, as they are not able to make it to the next checkpoint without being unloaded again.

trans-unit.source: In this case, you will receive the following exception with the failure.
trans-unit.target: In this case, you will receive the following exception with the failure.

trans-unit.source: The job cannot continue running because it was repeatedly evicted from the same checkpoint.
trans-unit.target: The job cannot continue running because it was repeatedly evicted from the same checkpoint.

trans-unit.source: Please make sure your Runbook does not perform lengthy operations without persisting its state.
trans-unit.target: Please make sure your Runbook does not perform lengthy operations without persisting its state.

trans-unit.source: When you create a runbook, you should ensure that the time to run any activities between two checkpoints will not exceed 3 hours.
trans-unit.target: When you create a runbook, you should ensure that the time to run any activities between two checkpoints will not exceed 3 hours.

trans-unit.source: You may need to add checkpoints to your runbook to ensure that it does not reach this 3 hour limit.
trans-unit.target: You may need to add checkpoints to your runbook to ensure that it does not reach this 3 hour limit.

trans-unit.source: You may also need to break up long running operations.
trans-unit.target: You may also need to break up long running operations.

trans-unit.source: For example, your runbook might perform a reindex on a large SQL database.
trans-unit.target: For example, your runbook might perform a reindex on a large SQL database.

trans-unit.source: If this single operation does not complete within the fair share limit, then the job will be unloaded and restarted from the beginning.
trans-unit.target: If this single operation does not complete within the fair share limit, then the job will be unloaded and restarted from the beginning.

trans-unit.source: In this case, you should break up the reindex operation into multiple steps, such as reindexing one table at a time, and then insert a checkpoint after each operation so that the job could resume after the last operation to complete.
trans-unit.target: In this case, you should break up the reindex operation into multiple steps, such as reindexing one table at a time, and then insert a checkpoint after each operation so that the job could resume after the last operation to complete.
